CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, March 21, 1964, pg. 6 reads: "The D.I.'s In Sheets - The fashionable members of the D.I. Club, who are noted for being among the best dressed in Pittsburgh, turned out in sheets, draped and pinned to look like gowns, for their benefit last Sunday at the Hilton Hotel. Left to right: Mildred Conner, Margaret Watson, secretary; Nellye Barron, financial secretary; Mary Jean Eaton, honorary member, of Los Angeles, Calif.; Birdie Dunlap, Juanita L. Drake, president; Alberta Thompson, Gloria Grate, treasurer, and Evelyn Christian, co-chairman. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of Gloria Golden Grate and Alberta Thompson, wearing light colored sheets with broochs, holding bottle of Barclay's Bourbon with man wearing dark suit, and patterned necktie, standing in interior of Hilton Hotel for benefit
